snippet: The hunt for new oil and gas reserves is heading into Africa and other unexplored territories as subsidies for alternative energy are cut and as a result of the nuclear crisis in Japan last year.
abstract: Big oil companies are investing tens of billions of the dollars as part of an exploration boom in Eastern Africa; region is one among many worldwide that is seeing more production as global demand for fossil fuels increases; reduced demand for nuclear and renewable energy, new-found fossil fuel reserves and slashed subsidies for alternative energy have led to major shifts in development and increased levels of carbon dioxide
lead_paragraph: The hunt for new oil and gas reserves is heading into Africa and other unexplored territories as subsidies for alternative energy are cut and as a result of the nuclear crisis in Japan last year.

headline.seo: Quest for New Fossil Fuels Goes to Africa and Beyond
headline.main: Out of Africa (and Elsewhere): More Fossil Fuels
